Title: My Linux Journey
Content: My Linux Journey: WSL -> Ubuntu -> EndeavorOS (Arch-based) -> Omarchy. Recently, I completely corrupted my EndeavourOS setup... failure forced me to finally understand how my OS actually works. Key takeaways: EVERYTHING is a file/folder... I’ll be publishing a guide next week.

Title: Voice to Text on Linux
Content: I love the open source community. I really wanted the functionality of the Mac and Windows exclusive Wispr Flow on my Linux setup. I found HyprFlow... It is perfect for prompting AI and replying to messages efficiently.

Title: Learning Go Resources
Content: Found this neat YouTube playlist made by Matt Holiday for anyone that wants to learn Go. I realized I may have skipped some crucial Go basics... Been trying to work on writing more notes using Obsidian.

Title: Hyprtask Refactor
Content: Refactored my Go TUI (Hyprtask) task manager data pipeline. Key changes: Enhanced procfs integration, Single efficient pipeline, Bubbles table component. Much cleaner architecture and better performance.

Title: Converting a Friend to Linux
Content: Just got my friend Alex Leventis to see the beauty of Hyprland! He was on Ubuntu... I showed him the magic of workspaces and tiling window management. Omarchy comes with Hyprland and Arch pre-installed.

Title: Hyprtask Message Passing
Content: Made progress on Hyprland, my workspace-based terminal task manager, today. Implemented Bubble Tea’s message passing system for screen navigation. The message passing keeps everything clean.

Title: Orlando JUG Meetup
Content: Great time at the Orlando JUG (Java User Group) meetup this week for the developer career talk. I learned that Java has a mascot, and I got to learn all about REPUTATION: Responsibility Expertise Purpose Uplift Take Action Autonomy Trust.

Title: Hyprtask Responsiveness
Content: Excited to share a key update on my TUI task manager for Hyprland, the layout is now fully responsive! I implemented this using Go and the Bubble Tea framework. The Elm-style architecture makes it simple to handle terminal resize events.
Theme: GoLang, TUI, BubbleTea, Responsiveness, SoftwareDevelopment, Hyprland

Title: AI for UI Design
Content: Just shipped my first attempt at a TUI for HyprTask. I took inspiration from Lawrence Lockhart talk on using JSON for AI prompts. Instead of describing layouts in plain text, I built structured JSON prompts to define every element.
Theme: Go, TUI, BubbleTea, Hyprland, OpenSource, JSON, PromptEngineering, AI

Title: Learning Go Concurrency
Content: Working on hyprtask for Hyprland! Today I learned about Go mutexes & channels. Basically a safe way to access data that's being used by multiple concurrent functions. Used them to build a solid data pipeline.

Title: Building HyprTask
Content: I’ve been using Linux (Arch btw) on and off for about a year now... To do so, I’m building a terminal-based task manager in Go, designed for the Hyprland window manager. It’s workspace-aware.

Title: Developer Portfolio Launch
Content: I just published a blog post about my League of Legends–inspired developer portfolio! One of my favorite features is a real-time tracker that pulls live data from LeetCode, GitHub, Anki, and Riot’s API.

Title: CYC2025 Conference Takeaways
Content: Had an amazing time in Dallas for #CYC2025. Here are a few lessons I’m taking away: 1. Promote Positivity 2. Contribute to Open Source 3. Build a Network. It was such a valuable experience.
